reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose the Covo for our honeymoon and we were not disappointed! As soon as we arrived we were welcomed warmly by the front desk staff and shown to our beautiful room on the 5th floor. The room was beautiful, a terrace overlooking the sea with 2 comfortable sunbeds. The room was exceptionally clean, the cleaner came in TWICE a day! The bed was changed daily and towels delivered twice a day! We ate mainly in the hotel restaurant which was superb. A couple of nights we ate at the restaurant Max which had been recommended by the hotel. This restaurant was also divine but the view at the Covo was too good to miss! Salvatore in the bar, Paolo, Antoniella etc in the restaurant and Antonio on the reception were all fabulous and made our stay amazing. Our stay was topped off to perfection when we were driven back to Naples by Poppy our driver. He played us traditional Italian music and pointed out all the tourist sights, he was very entertaining. Italy, The Covo dei Saraceni and all the people we met were FABULOUS!!! Can't wait to return!!! I would stay in this hotel every year if I could!!!!
reviews.title: Perfect honeymoon location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If, as they say, the perfection of art is to conceal art, Saraceni excels. We spent five days here as a part of our Italian Honeymoon, and it was the hotel highlight. I would probably be repeating a lot of the other reviews if I go into depth about the breakfast, scenery and pool, so let it suffice to say this: splurge for the more expensive room if you are able, and let the staff know if you are celebrating (champagne will await you)! Though there were many obnoxious children in the pool some of the days, the staff was great at shooing them away from us, and trying to maintain the peace and tranquility that adults so enjoy at a 5L star hotel. The food is amazing at the hotel and nearby restaurants, you really can't go wrong here. Another huge boon for this hotel is its location--directly off the ferry docks, so you don't need to bother yourselves with porter services, or climbing up ridiculous heights to reach your destination. Hopefully we'll be back someday.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing place. The location was perfect and the staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positano is breath taking. The breakfast included was great.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in all of Italy...Stay Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Loved it and would love to return.
reviews.title: Great location and terrific service and spotlessly clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The opportunity to sit on the balcony of one of the water-facing rooms of the Saraceni and watch the beach scene is an integral part of Positano as we have come to know and love it. Since we first came here the rooms have been remodeled—so the prices have gone up but for my money this hotel is still a great bargain especially when compared to the super luxe San Pietro and Sireneuse which are admittedly more luxurious but not nearly so well situated to be part of, but not overwhelmed by, the action. The hotel restaurant is really one of the better ones in town and the pool is a very pleasant place to loll around.
reviews.title: The balconies of Covo dei Saraceni--wonderful place to watch the beach action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is fine (though neither the coffee nor the orange juice is top drawer) but in an overly large banquet room which seems kind of lonely. That concern melts away, however, when you take the plate you’ve filled from the buffet to the glassed in porch area where you actually sit to eat it—and can see more than180 degrees of beach and blue water. It’s a great way to start the day. But it’s those balconies overlooking the beach that make it THE place to stay IMO. If you don’t want to pop for a balcony room, stay somewhere else. That’s what this place is all about.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, friendly staff but beds could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited Covo dei Saraceni with my wife for 5 nights on our honeymoon. The location was absolutely perfect, right on the beach and the view from the room was sensational. The staff were very friendly and helpful also. The large pool on the rooftop made it even better. The only criticism I have is the beds as they were very hard & the pillows were flat - not good if you suffer from a bad back.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel with wonderful staff. The hotel was in a perfect location close to the beach , restaurants and shops. The view from our room was breathtaking and the pool was fantastic.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: great time with special peoples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in positano on a few occasions but never here before . I will not need to look elsewhere in future .It was my partners first visit to the coast and she fell for it immediately and the situation of the hotel is second to none . The staff are so friendly and helpful throughout the hotel . odd little things coud improve a bit - the breakfast is a little below what one might expect and cooked items not readily replaced but that is being picky - it was a super experience . The barman - sal I think - what a lovely man and so friendly and interested in what he does - a real asset . Food in restaurant excellent and a clever 25% discount for residents as there is a lot of competition nearby - particularly the excellent Chez Black - definitely return . Superb pool and staff there too were good . very reasonably priced for such a spot and such a good hotel . well done to all
reviews.title: stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the most amazing hotel, can't say anything bad about it! Fabulous location, stunning rooms and views, great food. You must stay here!! It's also not that expensive compared to other hotels in the area. I loved it so much I think we're going back for our honeymoon! First class!
reviews.title: Fantastic place, so very beautiful - faultless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently had our destination wedding in Positano, Italy, and we stayed at the Covo dei Saraceni while we were in town. I understand that because of the personal memories we have of the town (getting married during our stay, having friends and families there to celebrate with us, etc), our review of the town will likely be biased. However, please know that the headline is very genuine: Positano is quite literally the most beautiful place we've ever visited, and the Covo was an incredible hotel to call home during our stay.
reviews.title: Literally the most beautiful place we've ever been.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Covo's charm greets you even before you walk through the doors. As with most buildings in Positano, it is built into the cliffside. Flowers and vines cascade down the hotel's rock face and nearly cover the Covo's simple white sign as they camoflauge the front door. From the outside, this stone-and-ivy facade make it resemble a quaint house. Once you walk through the doors, nothing could be further from the truth.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel set into a magical view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An impressive lobby opens onto a lounge filled with bright white couches that overlook the beach below. The hotel staff is always at the ready to help you. Given that we were married during our stay, we had plenty of irregular and over-the-top requests that the staff was always happy to take care of. We sent packages to the hotel early, which they held for our stay and had delivered to our room. A complimentary bottle of local Prosecco was chilled in our room upon arrival. A few days before the wedding, the hotel arranged for a local dry cleaner to pick up my suit and my wife's wedding dress, steam them, and bring them back to the hotel on the day before our wedding. Everything was taken care of for us, nothing was forgotten, and we were able to relax and truly enjoy our stay in this magical city.
reviews.title: Hotel Covo dei Sareaceni, a must to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: y husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary in Italy! Arriving from Naples we were greeted by Aldo, arranged by the hotel before our arrival, who drove us to The Covo Dei Saraceni Hotel. We received a warm friendly welcome from the Hotel Staff. Our room was airy, light, romantic, elegant, spacious and included all amenities. The views and location was magnificent. We were pleasantly surprised to find on our balcony a gift of champagne chilling on ice in a beautiful champagne bucket with glasses including a note of best wishes for our celebration, compliments from the Saraceni family. If you want to relax and enjoy the Italian life, hang out with the locals, soak up the sun and experience all the aromas, sights, sounds and beauty of Italy this is the place to stay. Church bells, children playing, laughing or calling for their mamas, the romantic italian language, the calming Salerno Bay waves, boats, magnificent food and wine— so very relaxing and magical. The hotel staff was pleasantly helpful with suggestions and arranging our day trips, recommending restaurants, making reservations and anything that would make our stay comfortable. Thank you to all at The Covo Dei Saraceni Hotel for the memorable visit! I would fly back right now if i could!!! —Audrey and Ed, Philadelphia PA
reviews.title: Relax in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is the perfect location if you are staying in Positano! The lobby of the hotel is absoluley beautiful as is the pool area and the views from the hotel. I have to admitt, I was a little dissapointed in the room though. It was on the small side and was very plain and ordinary. Based on the price, and the lobby and other areas of the hotel, I was expecting much much more with the room. Having a sea view is a must- the little patio off the room is adorable. The breakfast in the morning is awesome- it was the best breakfast our whole trip.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great views, decent room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 7 day stay in Positano and are already thinking about coming back! The hotel is in a prime location...and was one of the few with a pool, which was a huge benefit during this time of year. Due to location, we would recommend using the Metro Del Mare ferry for all excusions between the other Amalfi Coast towns or islands (Capri), since the Positano stop is steps away from the main entrance to Covo Dei Saraceni. We stayed in one of the JR Suite rooms that overlooked the beach - - beautiful! The rooms were spacious and were cleaned 2x a day. We could not ask for better service from everyone that worked at this hotel, from the front desk to the waitstaff at the restaurant/bars, they all went out of their way to assist in making our stay a pleasurable experience.
reviews.title: Best Hotel, Best Restaurant, Best Location in Positano...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also recommend eating at the restaurant. Not only was the food great (the eggplant parmesan is a must!), but our waiter Arturo recommended both meals to eat and what wines would best go with our entrees. To top it all off, hotel patrons receive a 25% discount off the meal which was very nice.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not that these are negatives, but we didn't think the continental breakfast was as great as people on this message board boasted. Lots of pastries and cereals, but the spread seemed to be lacking. Sure there was scrambled eggs and sausage, but it left a lot to be desired. Also, getting seats at the pool are a premium so mark your territory before the pool opens up at 9, and make sure you get enough time poolside since they close it abnormally early (5pm).
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Relax
